reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major chromosomal deletion syndromes: 22q11 deletion (~40 per 100k live births), 5p deletion/cri-du-chat (~4 per 100k), 1p36 deletion (~10 per 100k), 4p deletion/Wolf-Hirschhorn (~2 per 100k), 18p deletion (~1 per 100k), plus additional rare deletion syndromes (~60 per 100k) = ~120 per 100k births. Note: Reported as incidence per 100k live births (not person-years) due to congenital nature. Very low confidence due to extreme heterogeneity of deletion types with vastly different clinical severity, lethality rates, and geographic variation.
